content: In Greek mythology, who was the god of wine, also associated with fertility, ritual madness, and religious ecstasy?

In Greek mythology, the god of wine, fertility, ritual madness, and religious ecstasy is Dionysus. He is one of the twelve Olympian gods and is known for his dual nature: he represents not only mirth, pleasure, and celebration but also chaos and disorder. Dionysus is often depicted wearing a crown of vines and leaves, carrying a thyrsus (a staff topped with a pinecone), and accompanied by satyrs and maenads, who are his female followers known for their wild, ecstatic rites. His Roman counterpart is Bacchus.
